description:
freetype: move the scaling from FUnits to pixels from package freetype
to package truetype.

messages.text:
Hello bsiegert@gmail.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/freetype-go

LGTM

http://codereview.appspot.com/6427062/diff/8001/freetype/truetype/glyph.go
File freetype/truetype/glyph.go (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/6427062/diff/8001/freetype/truetype/glyph.go#newcode109
freetype/truetype/glyph.go:109: // the resultant glyph will be hinted by the Font's bytecode instructions.
s/resultant/resulting/

http://codereview.appspot.com/6427062/diff/8001/freetype/truetype/truetype.go
File freetype/truetype/truetype.go (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/6427062/diff/8001/freetype/truetype/truetype.go#newcode14
freetype/truetype/truetype.go:14: // 64 units per pixel is recommended as it is what is assumed by the optional
"as it is what is" sounds awkward. Please rewrite.

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/freetype-go/source/detail?r=15b6d4e04151 ***

freetype: move the scaling from FUnits to pixels from package freetype
to package truetype.

R=bsiegert
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/6427062

subject: code review 6427062: freetype: move the scaling from FUnits to pixels from p...
